head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: Diamond Club To Stay Put

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: Diamond Club To Stay Put
hedline.hl2: Manhattan: Diamond Club to Stay Put

body.head.byline: By CHARLES V. BAGLI; Compiled by John Sullivan

abstract.p: New York City Diamond Dealers Club renews lease at longtime home on Fifth Avenue in Manhattan despite attempt by developer Gary Barnett to lure club to nearby planned tower, which he says will revitalize city's diamond and jewelry industry (S)

block.p: In a setback for the developer Gary Barnett, the Diamond Dealers Club, a mainstay of the diamond district, has renewed its lease at its longtime home, 580 Fifth Avenue, near 47th Street. Mr. Barnett had hoped to lure the club to his planned 35-story tower on 47th Street, which he said would revitalize the city's diamond and jewelry industry. In November, the developer got a $49.6 million subsidy package from the city, to the annoyance of the owners of 580 Fifth and other landlords. Jacob Banda, president of the diamond club, said yesterday that in the end he had doubts about whether Mr. Barnett's tower would materialize. He said his landlord offered him a good deal on a 10-year lease, so he took it. Mr. Barnett insisted yesterday that his project was going forward, and he said the club had made ''a major, major mistake.''
